ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry reveals mixed hearing loss bilaterally (low-frequency air-bone gaps); left ear status post-modified radical mastoidectomy.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To monitor hearing sensitivity in a patient with long-standing asymmetric loss and history of mastoid surgery.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Standard test for middle ear function, though often contraindicated or not performed in cases with mastoid bowls.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Testing reveals an asymmetric hearing loss. The right ear shows a slight to mild mixed loss in low frequencies sloping to a moderate-to-severe sensorineural loss in high frequencies, with excellent word recognition. The left ear shows a moderate-to-severe mixed loss sloping to profound, with poor word recognition. Results are stable compared to prior testing.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight sloping to mild mixed loss (250-1000 Hz) to moderate-to-severe SNHL (2000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Moderate sloping to severe mixed loss (250-2000 Hz) to profound (3000-8000 Hz). RE thresholds: 250Hz 25, 1000Hz 35, 4000Hz 75 dB HL. LE thresholds: 250Hz 55, 1000Hz 70, 2000Hz 80 dB HL. Masking dilemma noted for right bone conduction.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 37 dB HL, WRS 100% at 75 dB HL. Left ear: SRT 72 dB HL, WRS 50% at 95 dB HL. Patient unable to tolerate levels >95 dB HL in left ear.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not measured due to surgical history.

proposed_items: Continue use of amplification in the right ear
Reconsider a trial of amplification in the left ear
counseling_actions: Discussed stability of hearing sensitivity compared to previous tests
Discussed challenges of fitting the left ear due to severity of loss and history of discomfort
Advised to continue 6-month follow-ups with otologist for mastoid cavity cleaning

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is already followed every six months for cleaning of the mastoid cavity bowl.

expected_outcome: Hearing loss had progressed gradually bilaterally.
Patient will follow up with the otologist as scheduled.
Audiological recommendations were to return for hearing testing annually, continue right ear amplification, reconsider left ear amplification, and use HAT.
